content.en: Simulation-based training: Simulation-based training using algorithms as tools for surgical education, team training, learning, and evaluation has been found to improve various aspects of healthcare, such as team interaction, educational competencies, teamwork, confidence, communication, mastery of management skills, retention of knowledge, clinician performance, competence, self-efficacy, and the transition to clinical practice. Different modalities and levels of simulation fidelity, including video-based and high-fidelity simulation, rapid cycle deliberate practice, reflective debriefing, low-fidelity in-situ simulation, and telesimulation, have been explored and found to be effective in enhancing healthcare professionals' skills and knowledge in handling critical situations.
content.da: Simulationsbaseret træning: Simulationsbaseret træning ved brug af algoritmer som værktøjer til kirurgisk uddannelse, holdtræning, læring og evaluering har vist sig at forbedre forskellige aspekter af sundhedspleje, såsom holdinteraktion, uddannelseskompetencer, teamwork, selvtillid, kommunikation, beherskelse af ledelsesevner, fastholdelse af viden, klinikerens ydeevne, kompetence, selvvirkning og overgangen til klinisk praksis. Forskellige modaliteter og niveauer af simulationsfidelitet, herunder videobaseret og højtroværdig simulation, hurtig cyklisk øvelse, reflekterende debriefing, lavtroværdig in-situ simulation og telesimulation, er blevet udforsket og fundet effektive til at forbedre sundhedspersonalers færdigheder og viden i at håndtere kritiske situationer.
